summary: The Veterans Health Administration will spend about $81 billion on care for about 6.9 million patients this year. Higher-than-expected needs have prompted it to repeatedly request supplemental funds. We reviewed how VHA allocated and monitored use of these funds. When VHA allocated funds to regional networks and medical centers, it did not use the most recent data on workloads VHA did not adequately monitor how...
title: Veterans Health Care: VA Needs to Improve Its Allocation and Monitoring of Funding
